remarks: Principle of Transfinite Recursion, part 2 of 3.  Theorem 7.41(2) of [TakeutiZaring] p. 47.  Here we show that the function ` F ` has the property that for any function ` G ` whatsoever, the "next" value of ` F ` is ` G ` recursively applied to all "previous" values of ` F ` . (Contributed by NM, 9-Apr-1995.)  (Revised by Stefan O'Rear, 18-Jan-2015.)
statement:
tfr.1 $e |- F = recs ( G ) $.
tfr2 $p |- ( A e. On -> ( F ` A ) = ( G ` ( F |` A ) ) ) $.
